description:
On this  walk you will see some of the forgotten contributions of Victorian women to the magnificent buildings of South Kensington, in particular the V&A and the Royal Albert Hall. 

You will also see how women were represented very differently from men on the buildings and memorials of this internationally important arts and science district.

events.name: Designed to be Forgotten: Women in South Kensington
Designed to be Forgotten: Women in South Kensington

factsheet.heading: Introduction
paragraphs: Join Iya London for a thought-provoking walking tour exploring the hidden contributions of Victorian women to the architecture and design of South Kensington.
Discover how they helped shape this renowned arts and science district—and why their stories remain largely untold.
You'll also explore the differing representations of men and women in the area’s public spaces. This walk will change the way you see South Kensington!

factsheet.heading: What You’ll See
paragraphs: We'll focus on the Victoria and Albert Museum, the Royal School of Mines, the Memorial to the 1851 Great Exhibition,  the Royal Albert Hall and the Albert Memorial.

factsheet.heading: About Your Guide
paragraphs: Joanna Oyediran is a qualified Open City guide. She regularly leads walks round White City for Open City as part of their year-round tours programme.  Her other clients have included the Royal College of Art, the LSE, the Great Exhibition Road Festival, and Planning Aid for London.
Joanna is the founder of Iya London, which unearths and shares London’s overlooked stories, past and present.

factsheet.heading: Meeting Point
paragraphs: We'll meet just outside the entrance to the V&A on Exhibition Road.

factsheet.heading: Get in Touch
paragraphs: For all inquiries about this and other walks please check the website iyalondonwalks.com or contact iyalondonwalks@gmail.com

factsheet.heading: Golden Key Academy
paragraphs:
This tour is led by an alumnus of Open City’s Golden Key Academy - an eight-month course designed to train insightful and engaging guides who bring London’s rich stories to life.		
		
Learn more about the Golden Key Academy here: open-city.org.uk/golden-key-academy

location.address: Outside the V&A Exhibition Road Entrance, Exhibition Road, SW7 2PA
travel_info: Additional travel info: The walk ends at Kensington Gore, north of the Royal Albert Hall.

name: Designed to be forgotten: women in South Kensington
